oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nanostructured Anodic Multilayer Dielectric Stacked Metal-Insulator-Metal Capacitors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KARTHIK, R
KANNADASSAN, D
BAGHINI, MS
MALLICK, PS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: TANTALUM SUPERIMPOSED LAYERS
O-18 TRACING TECHNIQUES
MIM CAPACITORS
NUCLEAR MICROANALYSIS
ELECTRICAL CHARACTERIZATION
GATE DIELECTRICS
ALUMINUM-OXIDE
ANODIZATION

NIOBIUM

High-k
Leakage Mechanisms
Metal-Insulator-Metal (MIM)

Quadratic Voltage Coefficient of Capacitance
TiO2
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents the fabrication of Al2O3/TiO2/Al2O3 metal-insulator-metal (MIM) capacitor using anodization technique. High capacitance density of >3.5 fF/mu m(2), low quadratic voltage coefficient of capacitance of <115 ppm/V-2 and a low leakage current density of 4.457 x 10(-11) A/cm(2) at 3 V are achieved which are suitable for analog and mixed signal applications. We found that the anodization voltage played a major role in electrical and structural properties of the thin film. This work suggests that the anodization method can offer crystalline multilayer dielectric stack required for high performance MIM capacitor.
